summary: The headline numbers for Global Payments (GPN) give insight into how the company performed in the quarter ended June 2025, but it may be worthwhile to compare some of its key metrics to Wall Street estimates and the year-ago actuals.

headline: Global Payments beats profit estimates on core business strength
summary: Global Payments' adjusted net revenue rose 5% on a constant currency basis in the quarter ended June 30.  Adjusted revenue from its merchant solutions business rose 5.5% on a constant currency basis in the quarter, with margins expanding by 130 basis points.  In April, Global Payments agreed to buy rival Worldpay from FIS and private equity firm GTCR for $24.25 billion in a three-way deal, sharpening its focus on merchant services in its race for big-business clients in a crowded payments market.

headline: Global Payments: Q2 Earnings Snapshot
summary: ATLANTA (AP) — Global Payments Inc. GPN) on Wednesday reported second-quarter profit of $241.6 million. On a per-share basis, the Atlanta-based company said it had profit of 99 cents.

headline: S&P 500 and Nasdaq lifted by earnings, Fed hopes
summary: The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq edged higher on Wednesday, buoyed by a new round of corporate earnings, while lingering hopes that the Federal Reserve will cut rates kept markets alive.  At 9:37 a.m. ET, the Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 2.89 points, or 0.01%, to 44,114.63, the S&P 500 gained 7.58 points, or 0.12%, to 6,306.64 and the Nasdaq Composite rose 43.34 points, or 0.21%, to 20,959.89.  Arista Networks soared 13.6% as the cloud networking company projected quarterly revenue above analyst estimates.
